Documentation for pyspawn module¶

spawn¶

pyspawn.spawn.run_input_file(script, program='python3', input_file='', timeout=0, output_file='', append_output=False, watch_for='', header='')[source]¶

Run a system command with line separated input file for script STDIN.

Parameters:
  • script (str.) – File to run with program argument’s program.
  • program (str.) – Command-line command to run.
  • input_file (str.) – Path to file containing lists of strings to send to STDIN.
  • timeout (int.) – Maximum time command is able to execute before program is killed.
  • output_file (str.) – Path to file used to save captured STDOUT instead of the console.
  • append_output (bool.) – Append STDOUT to output file. (Default– False, overwrite contents of output file).
  • watch_for (str.) – Text to listen for in STDOUT. If text is discovered, the command is killed immediately after.
  • header (str.) – Send this text to STDOUT before the command is executed.
Returns:

int – 0 if successful, 1 if not.
pyspawn.spawn.run_input_list(script, program='python3', input_args=None, timeout=0, output_file='', append_output=False, watch_for='', header='')[source]¶

Run a system command with list of strings for script STDIN.

Parameters:
  • script (str.) – File to run with program argument’s program.
  • program (str.) – Command-line command to run.
  • input_args (list.) – List of strings to send to STDIN one item of the list at a time.
  • timeout (int.) – Maximum time command is able to execute before program is killed.
  • output_file (str.) – Path to file used to save captured STDOUT instead of the console.
  • append_output (bool.) – Append STDOUT to output file. (Default– False, overwrite contents of output file).
  • watch_for (str.) – Text to listen for in STDOUT. If text is discovered, the command is killed immediately after.
  • header (str.) – Send this text to STDOUT before the command is executed.
Returns:

int – 0 if successful, 1 if not.
